thread.title: Freeman finishes 2nd for Lyndon at states
thread.title_full: Freeman finishes 2nd for Lyndon at states

author: Reformer Staff
title: Freeman finishes 2nd for Lyndon at states
text:
Freeman finishes 2nd for Lyndon at states 
Reformer Staff Posted: 10/05/2015 07:55:31 PM EDT Updated: 10/05/2015 07:55:32 PM EDT Click photo to enlarge 1 Â» 
JOHNSON >> 2015 Brattleboro Union High School graduate Becca Freeman placed 44th overall to help the Lyndon State College women's cross-country team finish fifth at the Vermont Intercollegiate Championships held at Johnson State College on Saturday. 
"In spite of cold and illness going around the team, the ladies continue to make progress," said Lyndon coach Chris Ummer. "The women continue to train hard and stay focused on our season goals for the conference meet. Sophomore Alesha Donovan is beginning to make progress in the direction of the season goals." 
Freeman finished the hilly 5K race in 24:54. Also scoring for the Hornets were: Sierra Hargrave in 38th, Alesha Donovan in 57th, Rose Wilson in 58th and Elizabeth Start in 67th. 
Middlebury College won the six-team competition with 15 points by sweeping the first five spots. Norwich, St. Michael's, Castleton and Lyndon rounded out the Top 5. 
Freeman began her freshman season by finishing first for Lyndon State and 16th overall in 23:47 at the Husson University Invitational. She then led her team again by taking 30th overall in 22:15 at the Bowdoin College Invite in Maine. 
The Hornets will compete in the Connecticut College Invitational in New London, Conn., on Oct. 17. Advertisement
